channel.title: Updates: Work Stoppages [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's Work Stoppages request

item.title: Partial Grant
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On February 9, 2023, FMCS‚Äôs FOIA office responded with a ‚Äúpartial grant,‚Äù providing the Data Liberation Project with just one documentation file, and withholding all other records. ‚ÄúThere are 733 pages of records fully redacted under FOIA Exemption 4 and 6,‚Äù according the agency‚Äôs letter. In the meantime, we‚Äôve uploaded the one file the agency did provide: An Excel spreadsheet named ‚ÄúProd Schema.xlsx‚Äù. (The Data Liberation Project intended to appeal the decision, but ultimately missed the deadline to do so.)

item.title: Extension Letter
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On January 25, 2023, FMCS emailed a letter üìÑ “notifying you of an extension of our time to respond by 10 business days due to the following reason as provided by 5 U.S.C. ¬ß 552(a)(6)(B)(i): The need to search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request.”
